Make Cut Out Snowflakes Day, celebrated each year, is a fun-filled day dedicated to crafting and creating unique paper snowflakes. This popular holiday tradition dates back to the 19th century, when it was first introduced by Fran Zach of The Ladies' Home Journal. Now, everyone can join in the fun and make these special decorations to keep or to give away.

Call a Friend Day is a day dedicated to reconnecting with old friends and socializing. It encourages people to reach out and have meaningful conversations. It was started in 2008 and is celebrated annually. On this day, people reach out to old friends and loved ones to remind them how much they care.

National Pepper Pot Day is held annually to celebrate the beloved Philadelphia staple. The traditional pepper pot soup has been a staple of the city's cuisine since the Revolutionary War. Celebrate National Pepper Pot Day with a bowl of Philadelphia's iconic soup!

National Bicarbonate of Soda Day celebrates one of America's oldest and most versatile products. Used in baking, cleaning, scratch removers, and many other applications, bicarbonate of soda is a natural, non-toxic staple found in many households. A05 the world celebrates this useful, time-honored product.

Celebrate Make Up Your Mind Day! On this day, everyone is invited to make up their own minds, outsourced beliefs aside. It’s a reminder to trust our own thoughts and ideas. Its origins go back to the 1971 Women's Movement. As part of their empowering message, women proposed that making up our own minds is essential for deciding how to live.

Balloons Around the World Day is an annual event, created in 2011. It reminds us to take the time to appreciate the joy, whimsical beauty, and possibilities that balloons bring to our lives. This holiday is a chance to send a balloon into the sky with a wish, draw a special wish in the sky, or honor someone important in our life.

National Name Your Car Day is an exciting, annual celebration that gives car owners the chance to express their creativity! It's thought to have started in the 1960s as a way for car owners to show off their individuality. Celebrate National Name Your Car Day by picking the perfect name for your ride!

National Boyfriend Day celebrates the supportive and loving relationships in our lives. It falls on October 3rd each year and was created to be a fun way to show the special men in our lives they're loved and appreciated. So don't forget to make your special guy feel loved on National Boyfriend Day!

Celebrate National Taco Day on October 4th and enjoy the tasty combination of meat, veggies, cheese, and spices wrapped in a warm tortilla. Started by National Taco Day founder, Juan Coulson, this holiday has been celebrated since 2009 to appreciate the tasty Mexican delicacy. Enjoy tacos that day without any guilt!

Celebrate being unique and dancing to the beat of your own drum on Get Funky Day! This annual celebration encourages everyone to explore their passions and proudly express themselves. First established in 2018, Get Funky Day was started to promote acceptance and diversity. Let's all embark on an adventure of self-discovery and make each day a bit funkier.

National Noodle Day celebrates all things noodle! Originating in Japan in 1995, this foodie holiday has expanded into a worldwide celebration of the versatile noodle! From ramen to mac & cheese to pho, enjoy your favorite noodle dish to join in the celebration.

National Inner Beauty Day is an annual celebration of one's inner beauty. It encourages people to recognize and affirm the unique qualities that make up their individual selves. First founded in 2019, it is now celebrated on the first Sunday of March around the world. It is a special day for self-love and self-appreciation. #NationalInnerBeautyDay!

National Pierogi Day celebrates the traditional Eastern European dish! Pierogis (dumplings filled with various ingredients) have a long history during holidays throughout the year. Though the exact origin is unknown, the pierogi has become a staple in many countries and is celebrated every year!

National Sneakers Day is an annual celebration on the first Saturday of April. It’s a day to honor and recognize the classic fashion statement of sneakers everywhere. From Keds, to Converse and Nikes, sneakers are an iconic part of fashion history. Talk about classic, National Sneakers Day has been around since the 1940s, when the term sneakers first appeared. Let’s lace up and celebrate!

National Hug a Drummer Day is an informal holiday celebrated every year. The day acknowledges the hard work of drummers and their unique contributions to all types of music. It was first celebrated in 2001 to honor the influence of drummers and their art form. Celebrate the day by giving a drummer in your life a big hug!

National Sausage Pizza Day celebrates this delicious Italian-American dish. Sausage pizza is thought to have originated in the 1920s in America after Italian immigrants brought the tasty topping to the US. Celebrate National Sausage Pizza Day with your favorite version of this delicacy!

Pulled Pork Day celebrates the slow-roasted, tender pork shoulder, pulled apart and soaked in delicious barbecue sauce. The tradition dates back to colonial America and is now a beloved favorite throughout the South and beyond. Enjoy it with sides like coleslaw and fries.

National No Bra Day is an annual event celebrated every year to encourage women to go braless in an effort to raise awareness about breast cancer and its causes. Women are encouraged to join in this event to show solidarity and spread the message that the body should be celebrated, despite the risks of breast cancer. The exact origin of the holiday is unknown, but modern celebrations have been held since the early 2000s.

holiday_name: Be Bald and Be Free Day
holiday_blurb: Be Bald and Be Free Day is an international holiday celebrated every year as a way to demonstrate solidarity and support for those who have lost their hair due to chemotherapy or other medical conditions. The holiday has been celebrated since 2000 and is aimed at creating a sense of community, build self-esteem, and raise awareness about the realities of hair loss due to medical treatments.

National Grouch Day is a day to celebrate grouches, grumps, and all other forms of grumpiness! Founded in 2010 by Theodor Geisel (aka Dr. Seuss), this day encourages everyone to embrace their inner grumpy side for a day. Whether it's being cranky about the weather or grouching up the office, there's no better day to get your grouch on!

Dictionary Day is celebrated every year to recognize the birthday of Noah Webster, the father of the American dictionary. On this day, it's not only a celebration of writing and language, but also a chance to recognize the work of lexicographers who build and refine dictionaries. It's a day to learn new words, brush up on existing ones, and appreciate the power of language.

holiday_name: National Clean Your Virtual Desktop Day
holiday_blurb: National Clean Your Virtual Desktop Day is an annual event encouraging individuals, businesses, and educational institutions to take time to tidy up their digital workspaces. It's held on the third Monday in October to promote healthier working habits & increase productivity. This awareness day was founded in 2017 by IT professionals who understand the importance of decluttering.

Hagfish Day is a day for all to appreciate the unique and ancient hagfish. They inhabit our oceans, living in the muddy or sandy bottoms and secrete slime for self-defense. The hagfish has been around for 500 million years and is sometimes referred to as the “living fossil”. Whether as an educational tool for children or appreciation of the remarkable creature, Hagfish Day celebrates both!

National Make New Friends Day is celebrated annually. It is a day to welcome new people into your life, connect with those you haven't seen in a while, or just learn about individuals from different backgrounds. The day has been celebrated as a part of the National Friendship Day events since 2011.

International Chef's Day is celebrated yearly to celebrate the impact chefs have worldwide. It was created to pay homage to Auguste Escoffier, the French chef who pioneered modern culinary techniques and professional standards. Enjoy a special dish in honour of all chefs on this special day!

International Sloth Day was created to recognize and protect sloths, the beloved shy but endearing animals. Every year, people around the world focus on educating and inspiring the public to appreciate these gentle creatures and take action against their decline. The holiday was started by The Plant and Animal Welfare Society (PAWS) in 2010. #GoSloth!

Smart is Cool Day celebrates the joy of learning! It was founded in 2013 by a group of educators and parents who wanted to encourage students to have fun while learning. Every year, students and families around the world join together in celebrating the power of knowledge. They share stories of success, mark their accomplishments, and recognize the importance of education.

TV Talk Show Host Day celebrates the incredible work of TV talk show hosts - the faces of entertainment and news that have captivated audiences for decades. It was first established over 30 years ago to honour the very first talk show hosts and to reflect on the impact they've had on entertainment. From Late Night to The View, celebrate the brilliance of TV talk show hosts on this special day!

National Bologna Day is a day to appreciate the humble yet tasty bologna sausage. It was created when two bologna-loving congressmen from Pennsylvania organized a state-wide Bologna competition in 1954. Ever since, it's been an annual celebration of this hearty and savory delicacy.

International Artists Day celebrates the creative energy and accomplishments of people working in all forms of media - visual arts, literature, music, and performance. It was established in 2012 as an opportunity for artists around the world to share their inspiring stories and to foster connections between other artists. Join us in recognizing and honouring the amazing artists who bring joy and happiness to all of us. #InternationalArtistsDay

National Chicken Fried Steak Day is an annual event that celebrates the flavorful, traditional Southern dish which consists of a cube steak that has been coated with seasoned flour and pan-fried. It is typically served smothered in gravy. The dish is believed to have originated in the early 1870s in Texas. Celebrate this tasty and iconic dish by enjoying some delicious chicken fried steak!

Celebrate your individualism with Bandana Day! This worldwide holiday is a great opportunity to show off your style! The story of Bandana Day goes back to the 19th century, when bandanas were used as a symbol of unity by oppressed workers in their fight for justice and recognition. Today, we commemorate this important part of history by wearing the iconic symbol of freedom as a sign of solidarity.

Celebrate National Chocolate Day! In its honor, revel in the sweet luxury of indulging in a delicious piece of chocolate. This early-American tradition dates back to 1764, when the first chocolate factory began production of chocolate in Massachusetts. Enjoy this special holiday with friends and family!

National Oatmeal Day is a day in honor of the beloved breakfast staple. It's a day to acknowledge the health benefits of oats and a great excuse to enjoy this versatile, delicious, and nourishing meal. The idea can be traced back to the Quaker Oats Company in the 1800s, but it's now celebrated worldwide. Enjoy your oatmeal and celebrate this tasty (and healthy) holiday! #NationalOatmealDay

National Checklist Day celebrates the power of organization. On this day, we take time to remind ourselves to prioritize the task at hand. Established in 2019, National Checklist Day encourages individuals to use lists to stay efficient and productive throughout their daily tasks. Everyone can benefit from organization!

National Caramel Apple Day is a day to pay homage to the popular sugary snack made of apples covered in caramel. This holiday can be traced back to the 1950's when confectioners began dipping apples in caramel to make them even sweeter. Celebrate by making a homemade caramel apple or buying one of your favorite varieties!

National Cold Cuts Day celebrates the delicious bounty of cold cut sandwiches. Started in the US in 2018, it's become an international event dedicated to honoring the many varieties of cold cuts. From ham and salami to bologna and pastrami, National Cold Cuts Day is a day to enjoy a classic sandwich.

International Rescue a Cat Day is a day dedicated to saving the lives of cats in need. Founded in 2014, it encourages people around the world to adopt, spay/neuter, donate, and speak out about issues facing homeless cats. Every year, this special day helps give cats a chance for a better life. Let’s celebrate International Rescue a Cat Day and save more cats!

If Pets Had Thumbs Day celebrates the bonds between humans and animals. This international holiday celebrates the joys of pet ownership and encourages people to recognize the ways in which animals can improve our lives and even help us in everyday tasks. People share humorous stories of how their pets might benefit from having thumbs on this special day.

National Snack Day is an annual celebration of everyday indulgence. Celebrated each year, Food Lion became the official sponsor of the event in 2015. National Snack Day celebrates the small and satisfying snacks we reach for in between meals.

National Cheese Doodle Day is a day to celebrate the cheesy goodness of cheese doodles! Cheese doodles, a savory snack, were first invented by a quirky Brooklyn entrepreneur named Yellow Buccelato in 1948. Celebrate by indulging in the cheesy goodness!

National Frozen Food Day honors the invention of the frozen food industry. The first commercially produced frozen meals arrived in 1930, making meals much easier to store and prepare. Today, frozen foods can be found in many grocery stores, allowing for quick and tasty meals. Celebrate with a frozen meal of your choice!

Celebrate National Cereal Day! It's an annual recognition of this popular breakfast food and its colorful history. Enjoy a steaming bowl of your favorite cereal with all the fixings - warm milk, brown sugar, even fresh fruit - and indulge in a true breakfast classic.

Celebrate National Proofreading Day! First celebrated in 2011, it encourages people to value the importance of proofreading special documents and to appreciate the craft of writing. It's a day to hone your editing skills so that your work can be read with clarity and precision!

Celebrate National Crabmeat Day! Enjoy a variety of dishes featuring crabmeat from delicious bisques to crabcakes. This special day has been celebrated since the 1940s in the Chesapeake Bay area and is recognized as a day to enjoy the incredibly flavorful and nutritious seafood.

Celebrate the International Day of Awesomeness, an annual event of global fun and celebration that began in 2011. On March 19th, take a moment to appreciate something amazing in your life and spread good vibes worldwide. #IDoA #BeAwesome 🤩

World Plumbing Day is celebrated on 11th March every year to recognize the important role plumbers play in keeping up the health and sanitation of our world. Established in 2010, this day also highlights the vital part plumbing plays in reducing water-related illnesses and promoting safe drinking water. #WorldPlumbingDay

Every year, people around the world take part in International Fanny Pack Day: a day dedicated to celebrating the popular and iconic accessory. In honor of this beloved bag, fans wear their coolest and most outrageous fanny packs to share their enthusiasm for the fashion staple. International Fanny Pack Day dates back to the 1970s, when the fanny pack first gained mainstream popularity.

Earmuff Day is a fun and unique holiday to celebrate the invention of the modern-day earmuff! This holiday was first observed in 1873, when American physician Chester Greenwood patented the earmuff and millions of people around the world adopted them for wintertime warmth. Celebrate by donning your favorite set of earmuffs and enjoying the warmth they provide!

National Potato Chip Day is every year! It honors the delicious snack food and its long, flavorful history. Potato chips were invented in 1853 by the chef George Crum, and have since become a beloved and popular snack in many countries around the world. Celebrate by indulging in some spicy or sour chips, or whatever your favorite flavor may be!

Buzzards Day is an annual celebration held in Hinckley, Ohio, USA. It commemorates the miraculous return of the buzzards to Hinckley after they were believed to be destroyed in a fire in 1856. The event includes a parade and buzzard calling competitions, as well as other activities such as concerts, crafts, and food.

National Panda Day is an annual event celebrated to honor the beloved Giant Panda! Since its humble start in 2000, it has grown to be recognized by zoos and organizations all over the world. Celebrate by learning more about this iconic species and pledging to help protect and conserve wildlife!

Campfire Girls Day is a day to celebrate the legacy of the Girl Scouts. Since its founding in 1912, the organization has provided leadership, education and outdoors programs to millions of girls. The annual day commemorates the courage and spirit of the Campfire Girls, who have gone on to lead in all areas of society. Join the celebration and learn more about the legacy of the Campfire Girls.

Awkward Moments Day is an international day of celebration - and embracing - those embarrassingly awkward situations of life! Established in 2002 by self-proclaimed "professional klutz," Aaron Ackerman, this annual event encourages everyone to share their most awkward moments!

Certified Nurses Day (CND) was established in 1972 to recognize the hard work of certified nurses. Every year, certified nurses are recognized and celebrated for their dedication to excellence, ethics, and continuing education. CND is the perfect time to celebrate the vital role certified nurses have in healthcare.

International Day of Happiness is a day held every year to recognize the importance of happiness in the lives of people around the world. The initiative began in 2013 as part of the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network, with the purpose of encouraging citizens of all nations to foster well-being and create a more tolerant world.

Celebrate National Fragrance Day! First introduced in 2006, this special day is an opportunity to appreciate the diverse and complex world of perfumes & colognes. With a single spritz, a beautiful scent can instantly transport you to a special memory or place.

International Day of the Seal is celebrated annually with the aim of raising awareness of the importance of the conservation of seals and their habitats. It has its origins in the 1983 International Seal Conference which was held in Denmark and resulted in the CITES Seal Agreement, a legal agreement to protect the seals from hunting and exploitation.

National Puppy Day celebrates the unconditional love of puppies! Founded in 2006, the annual event encourages adoption from shelters and recognizes responsible breeders. Show your pup some love - every day! #NationalPuppyDay

National Cheesesteak Day celebrates the Philly classic! This beloved regional dish was first served in 1930s South Philadelphia by Pat and Harry Olivieri. This delicious sandwich has been enjoyed for decades and is now celebrated worldwide. Enjoy your cheesesteak!

International Waffle Day is an annual celebration of the beloved breakfast treat, waffles! The tradition has been around since the 18th century, when Swedish people began serving waffles as part of a meal during Easter celebrations. Nowadays, people from all over the world still enjoy this delicious food and celebrate this special day.

Purple Day is an international grassroots effort to raise awareness and support for epilepsy. Founded in 2008 by a Canadian girl named Cassidy Megan, it occurs every year to celebrate the strides made in epilepsy research and advocacy. It's a day for everyone to unite and celebrate the fight against epilepsy! #PurpleDay

National Joe Day is an unofficial holiday celebrated to honor the popular nickname "Joe". This holiday began in the early 2000s as a fun day to acknowledge the average Joe. Celebrate by using the nickname, having a cup of "Joe" coffee, or simply telling a friend that you appreciate them.

Celebrate National Black Forest Cake Day with a delicious slice of Germany's best! Black Forest Cake has been a popular German dessert since the 16th century, combining layers of chocolate cake, whipped cream, cherries, and kirschwasser (a cherry liqueur). Enjoy the classic balance of tart & sweet flavors for an indulgent treat!

Manatee Appreciation Day takes place annually to recognize the gentle giants of the sea. It was first established in 1995 and includes research campaigns, conservation initiatives and community events. Manatees play a crucial role in the ocean's delicate ecosystem, so let's honor them by participating in activities that help raise awareness.

holiday_name: Grass is Always Browner on the Other Side of the Fence Day
holiday_blurb: Grass is Always Browner on the Other Side of the Fence Day is a day to look past appearances and take a smile and a breath of fresh air. It encourages us to appreciate and find joy in the relationships and experiences we have and to not get caught up in comparison. The day was created in 2017 as a lighthearted way to break-up the somber month of November.

Dance Marathon Day is an annual celebration of community spirit, friendship, and charity. It began in the early 2000s as a way for students to come together and enjoy music, dance, and raise money for local charities. Over the years, Dance Marathon Day has grown to include more cities and events throughout the world, making it a day of fun, joy, and generosity.

National Girlfriend Day is a day for celebrating the special ladies in our lives. It's an opportunity to show appreciation for how much they add to our lives, and to tell them how much we care. It was first recognized in 2006 when the Girlfriends Network launched NationalGirlfriendsDay.com. Celebrate your girlfriends every August 1st!

National Coloring Book Day is a day dedicated to celebrating the joy and creativity derived from coloring! The holiday originated in Canada in the early 2000s, and has since been embraced by countries around the world. Grab some crayons and join in the fun!

National Grab Some Nuts Day is a day dedicated to celebrating and indulging in everyone's favorite snack. On this day, it's encouraged to make a special trip to the store, and stock up on your favorite type of nuts: walnuts, pecans, almonds, cashews, etc! This holiday has been celebrated for many years, and is a great way to show appreciation for our nutty friends.

National Chocolate Chip Cookie Day is celebrated each year, and is a holiday for chocolate chip cookie aficionados everywhere. It was introduced in 1987 to commemorate Ruth Graves Wakefield, the inventor of the famous chocolate chip cookie. Her invention of the cookie is believed to have occurred the same year. Celebrate by baking some cookies or visiting your favorite store!

Work Like a Dog Day, celebrated each year, is a day to recognize the hard work of man's best friend. This day was founded in 2013 to honor hardworking canines all over the world and to appreciate how their skills help us every day. Take some time on this special day to lavish your pup with treats and affection.

National Root Beer Float Day takes place annually and celebrates the classic summertime treat. It honors the invention of the root beer float by Frank J. Wisner in 1893. Wisner, an Ohio drug store owner, combined root beer with vanilla ice cream served in a mug, giving birth to this beloved summertime drink!

Celebrate the joy of the beach and the summertime with Beach Party Day! This fun-filled day usually falls on the first day of summer and includes activities like swimming, beach games, BBQs, music and more. It's the perfect time for everyone from children to adults to come together and soak up the summer sun.

International Cat Day is celebrated worldwide each year to raise awareness of cats, their world and help in their protection. It was established in 2002 by the International Fund for Animal Welfare (IFAW) to honor and appreciate cats of all breeds. Celebrate cats with purrs and cuddles!

National Book Lovers Day is a holiday to celebrate the joy of reading. It is celebrated each year and was first created in the US in 2006. It's the perfect day to curl up with a good book and share the love of reading with friends and family.

Celebrate National Bowling Day by rolling strikes on the lanes! This annual celebration began in 2006 to bring attention to the sport of bowling as a pastime, leisure activity, and competitive profession. Join friends and family for a friendly game of pins and have some fun!

holiday_name: National Play in the Sand Day
holiday_blurb: National Play in the Sand Day is a day to leave the worries behind, don a sunhat, and head to the shore! It celebrates the relaxation and creativity of playing in the sand, a beloved summer tradition for kids of all ages. This 1988-established holiday recognizes humanity's long-standing fascination with sand and is an occasion for friends and family to come together and have a day of sun and fun.

World Elephant Day is an annual event held annually to bring attention to and celebrate the majestic creatures. Originally started in 2012, World Elephant Day works to raise awareness about the urgent threats they face from poaching, habitat destruction, and other human-related causes. We must come together to protect elephants so that future generations can experience their beauty and wonder!

International Lefthanders Day is celebrated each year to honor the 10-15% of the population who are lefties! It was first observed in 1976 to raise awareness and celebrate the uniqueness and challenges of being a left-handed person. Let's put our hands together to recognize lefties everywhere!

National Financial Awareness Day is a day dedicated to raising awareness about the importance of financial literacy, security and responsibility. It encourages people to take charge of their finances, learn about budgeting and investing, and develop tools to make sound financial decisions. First celebrated in 2020, the day has been embraced by businesses, organizations, and individuals as a way to celebrate finance and personal wealth.

Celebrate National Relaxation Day each year! It's celebrated as a day to encourage people to take a break from their daily stress and to promote balance and healthy living. It was created in 1995 by director of the California Association of Marriage and Family Counselors, Ivan Lapointe. Take time to deserve yourself!

Hawaiian Shirt Day is a festive holiday celebrated annually on the third Friday of December or "Aloha Friday". This unique holiday commemorates Hawaiian culture and is recognized as an unofficial way to end the year. People celebrate by wearing brightly colored Hawaiian shirts along with beach-inspired accessories and music! It's a day of celebration and relaxation, perfect for winding down after a long year. So, join in on the fun and celebrate Hawaiian Shirt Day!

Celebrate your feline friends on National Black Cat Appreciation Day - a day devoted to recognizing and admiring the beauty and independence of black cats. This day was created in the United States in the 1990s to help reverse the superstitious stigma associated with these cats. Take some time to cuddle with your ebony furry friend or volunteer at your local animal shelter to help a lonely black kitty find its forever home.

Never Give Up Day is an annual celebration to remind us all to keep pushing for our goals and live by the motto "never give up". It was first started in 2010 by the Never Give Up Foundation in honor of its founder, dining mogul Andrea Bocelli.

National Potato Day celebrates the nutritional and economical importance of the potato. It is celebrated annually and was first observed in 2008 in the United Kingdom. The day serves to raise awareness of the importance of potatoes in promoting sustainable food security in developing countries. It’s also a great time to enjoy the delicious variety of potato dishes.

Celebrate your undying love for bacon! National Bacon Lover's Day celebrates a crispy, salty, flavor-filled favorite food. Dating back to the 18th century, the piggy treat has been a food mainstay and has continued to dominate modern palates. Celebrate this beloved national holiday by cooking up a favorite bacon dish.

Internet Self-Care Day is an annual day of awareness held annually to remind people to take care of their online safety and wellbeing. It began in 2017 and is meant to empower people to prioritize their own online security and stay informed about online safety issues. #InternetSelfCareDay

Eat a Peach Day celebrates the summer fruit each year! Established in the 1990s, it's a day for enjoying the sweet taste of a juicy peach grown ripe on the tree. The day is often celebrated with a picnic, peach pies or just chilled slices of the juicy fruit.

National Ride the Wind Day is observed every year. It honors two of the world's greatest innovators, the Wright brothers - Orville and Wilbur - and celebrates the birth of human flight. On this day in 1903, the brothers flew their machine, the "Wright Flyer," for the first powered, controlled, sustained, and human-piloted flight of an airplane.

International Strange Music Day (ISMDay) celebrates the power of imaginative and unique sounds in music. From the ancient to the avant-garde, musicians explore the boundaries of what sound can be and how we express ourselves with music. Established in 2015, ISMDay encourages people to explore different sounds, challenge conventions and to experience music in new ways.

Celebrate National Banana Split Day! Since its invention in 1904, the banana split has been an iconic summer dessert. Enjoy the classic combination of banana, ice cream, syrup, and whipped cream to honor this time-honored tradition.

Make Your Own Luck Day encourages you to take control of your destiny. Celebrated annually, the day inspires you to be bold and proactive to shape your own fate. Based on the ancient Chinese proverb that states "the best way to make your own luck is to be active and wise," the day honors success achieved through hard work and a positive attitude.

National Just Because Day gives us an opportunity to let our loved ones know we're thinking about them, with no special reason. It originated from a greeting card company in the late 2000s, but has since become a fun, unofficial holiday for people of all ages.

National Bow Tie Day is a day of celebration in honor of the fanciful neckwear. On August 28, the nation don their most outrageous bow ties and celebrate the quirky fashion statement. This special day first marked by the Bow Tie Challenge in 2015, as part of the Bow Tie Cause supporting youth education.

National Lemon Juice Day is a day to celebrate the sunny and refreshing flavour of this bright yellow citrus fruit! Historically, lemon juice has been popular for centuries for its general health benefits, culinary uses, and as a way to add a tart and zesty zing to drinks and dishes.

National Toasted Marshmallow Day is celebrated each year on August 30th. The day honors the traditional snack of a lightly toasted marshmallow over a campfire. It has been around since the early 1900s, bringing camping trips and evening bonfires to life with the delectable treat. Celebrate summer’s last glorious days by toasting marshmallows with your family and friends!

Eat Outside Day is a day to enjoy the fresh air and sun while you savor your food. Originating in 2014, it encourages everyone to take the opportunity to appreciate the beauty of nature while enjoying a meal. Whether you’re at the park, the beach, or on your own private balcony, this day celebrates the social and environmental aspects of outdoor eating.

Celebrate the freedom of going barefoot! National Go Barefoot Day is celebrated annually to remind us that feeling the grass beneath your toes is one of life’s simplest joys. Historians note that going barefoot has a variety of health benefits, and it was formerly a sign of poverty, but is now considered more of a fashion statement.

National Donut Day has its roots in WWI, when Salvation Army "donut lassies" served donuts to troops. Now, it's a celebration of the delicious, sugary treat we all know and love. Celebrate National Donut Day by treating yourself to the donut you've been craving!

Today, on National Egg Day, we celebrate the nature’s perfect food! Dating back to the Ancient Egyptians and Romans, eggs have been celebrated for centuries as a symbol of new life. Perfect for breakfast, lunch, dinner or a midnight snack, eggs are a nutrient-dense food packed with vitamins, minerals, and healthy fats that help you thrive. Celebrate National Egg Day and give thanks for this amazing food!

Celebrate cheesy deliciousness on National Cheese Day! It's an annual event to honor the dairy product and commemorate the invention of American cheese in 1916. Enjoy it with your favorite crackers or melted on top of your favorite dishes!

Hot Air Balloon Day celebrates the invention of hot air ballooning. The first hot air balloon flight was made by two French brothers, J.M. and J.A. Montgolfier, in Versailles, France. Each year on this day, people around the world commemorate the Montgolfiers' invention and the joy of hot air ballooning.

National Yo-Yo Day is celebrated every year in honour of Donald F. Duncan's birthday. Duncan was a yo-yo champion who popularized them through his company, the Duncan Yo-Yo Company. Celebrate the day by organizing a yo-yo competition or joining a yo-yo sale, or just by showing your love for yo-yos by giving the iconic toy a spin!

National Running Day is an annual event held on the first Wednesday of June, celebrating the joys of running. It is a day to spread awareness of the sport, reflect on how running makes a difference in the lives of those who participate, and encourage others to get out and take part. The holiday was first celebrated in 2009, promoted by the non-profit Run.org and publicised by the Road Runners Club of America.

National Best Friends Day is a day celebrated every year to honour and appreciate the friends and bonds we share with them. It was founded in 1935 by Friends Day Association, meant to encourage people to reach out to their friends and celebrate their relationships. Make sure you reach out to your closest friend and show them how much they mean to you!

International Dark 'n Stormy Day is an annual celebration of one of the world's most popular rum cocktails. Every year, participants across the globe drink Dark'n Stormy cocktails in honor of the traditional recipe. Originating in Bermuda, the official drink of their government is rum, ginger beer, and lime. Join the celebration and raise a glass!

National Iced Tea Day celebrates both the delicious drink and its rich history. Iced tea was first introduced to the US in 1904 at the World's Fair in St. Louis, and it quickly became one of the most popular drinks in the country. Raise a glass and celebrate National Iced Tea Day!

holiday_name: National Corn on the Cob Day
holiday_blurb: National Corn on the Cob Day is a day to celebrate the traditional summertime treat! It is celebrated annually and can be enjoyed boiled, grilled, or barbecued. The origin of National Corn on the Cob Day is unknown; however, it has been a part of summer celebrations since colonial times. Enjoy some corn on the cob and celebrate this special day!

National Peanut Butter Cookie Day is an annual celebration of one of the most beloved treats. First made in the US in the 1910s, these deliciously crunchy and sweet cookies are easy to make, utilizing only a few ingredients. From classic homemade recipes to store-bought varieties, peanut butter cookies can be enjoyed by all!

Celebrate National Sewing Machine Day! It's a day to honor the invention of the first usable sewing machine by Elias Howe in 1846 which revolutionized the world of fashion and revolutionized the industry. Enjoy spending time with friends and family celebrating the amazing world of sewing and quilting!

International Bath Day is a celebration of the act of bathing held annually around the world. The purpose is to bring awareness to the importance of hygiene and its role in keeping us healthy. Though the exact origins of the holiday are unknown, its roots can be traced back to the time of Ancient Greeks who took part in daily bathing rituals. Celebrate this International Bath Day by taking a well-deserved soak!

International Surfing Day is celebrated to honor the sport and lifestyle of surfing. This day recognizes the conservation aspects of surfing and provides opportunities for everyone to give back to the community. The event started in 2005 as a grassroots movement to bring people together to celebrate the sport, and the holiday has been a success ever since. Join the celebration today to surf, give back, and help keep our oceans healthy and safe!

Fresh Veggies Day originated as an easy way for communities to come together and celebrate healthy produce with farmers markets, cooking demos, and creative recipes. It is an opportunity to make preparing meals with fresh, locally grown veggies both fun and accessible.

Global Garbage Man Day is a day to recognize and celebrate the hard work of our dedicated garbage and waste collectors around the world! Established in 2014, Global Garbage Man Day is held each year to honor the unsung heroes who work tirelessly to keep our environment clean and safe. Take the time to thank your local garbage men and woman and recognize the tremendous achievement of their work!

International Picnic Day is the global celebration of eating outdoors! Celebrated annually, it's been around since 18th century Europe, spreading the message to take time to enjoy your meal in the beautiful outdoors with great company. Enjoy some special treats, a blanket, and a good spot to soak up the sun!

National Martini Day is celebrated every year! Celebrate by making a delicious martini, the traditional way. This iconic drink was popularized in the late 19th century, becoming nationally recognized in the 20s and 30s thanks to James Bond and his now famous phrase, 'shaken, not stirred'. Cheers!

Ugliest Dog Day celebrates the unique beauty of all dogs, from purebreds to mix breeds alike. On this day, dog owners around the world can show off their pooches in all their "ugly" glory. The holiday started in 2004 when the Sonoma-Marin Fair in Petaluma, California hosted an ugly dog contest, and the participation and enthusiasm it generated has made it a beloved annual tradition ever since.

National Selfie Day is celebrated each year. It's a day to take a picture of yourself and share it to celebrate your uniqueness! The unofficial holiday began in 2014, when Jesse randomly tweeted "National Selfie Day." Within minutes his tweet went viral and National Selfie Day was born! Put your best face forward and celebrate! #NationalSelfieDay

National Onion Ring Day is an annual celebration of the crispy, delicious snack. Though there is no known origin of the holiday, it is mulled over each year with enthusiasm. Today, let's all gather around and munch on onion rings in honor of their deliciousness! #NationalOnionRingDay

holiday_name: National Eat at a Food Truck Day
holiday_blurb: Celebrate a day full of flavor! On Nation Eat at a Food Truck Day, grab a bite to eat from the nation's favorite food trucks! National Eat at a Food Truck Day honors the classic, American eatery, from the invention of the hamburger and hotdog carts in the late 1800s to the growth of the modern food truck trend.

Swim a Lap Day is a yearly event dedicated to honoring swimmers worldwide. Held each summer, it celebrates the various competitions and achievements of competitive swimmers, uniting the global swimming community. It also encourages commitment and discipline, to pursue personal goals and aspirations.

Celebrate Color TV Day! This holiday marks the first successful transmission of a color television program in 1951, airing on CBS. Commemorate this remarkable advancement in technology with friends and family by watching your favorite shows in vibrant, living color! #ColorTVDay

Forgiveness Day is an international holiday which celebrates the power of forgiveness. It encourages all people to seek reconciliation with those they may have wronged or been wronged by. It is celebrated every year since 2012.

Celebrate National Bingo Day! This holiday has been observed annually since the 1970s in honor of the popular game. Share the camaraderie of this tradition with family, friends, and even strangers to enjoy some luck and laughter.

Celebrate National Tapioca Day! This day honors a starchy, flavorless, versatile ingredient used in puddings, breads, pancakes, and drinks around the world. It can trace its roots back to the Aztecs who used a root from the cassava plant to make flour. Bring out the tapioca to celebrate! #NationalTapiocaDay

Celebrate National Handshake Day! This special day honors one of the oldest forms of greeting and encourages people to show respect and appreciation for each other. It was first established in the US in 1986 and has since been adopted by organizations and governments around the world. Show your appreciation and respect to your family, friends, and the community with a simple handshake!

International Asteroid Day is an annual global observance that promotes awareness about asteroids and the potential hazards asteroids can bring to Earth. It is celebrated every year and was first instituted in 2016 by space experts and organizations such as the B612 Foundation, Association of Space Explorers and McGill University. The day calls for greater awareness and understanding of asteroids and how they can affect planetary bodies.
